p: The hydrolysis of triacylglycerides from milk results in the release of free fatty acids, causing the rancid taste of milk, and the authors compared new and standard methods for the analysis of fatty acids in milk, including the relation with rancid flavor, and found that hexanoic acid (C6) was the one that had a greater correlation with the rancid flavor [ 50]. In this trial, the C6 concentration in milk fatty acids was not different among treatments.
